By  Heather HoughJuly  

NIUs corporate relations program expansion led to a new position assistant director of corporate relations filled by an NIU alumnus PERIOD

Sherman Jenkins appointed associate director of corporate relations in May graduated from NIU in  with a bachelors degree in journalism PERIOD

Jenkins has worked in public relations consulting firms with nonprofit and profit organizations such as McDonalds and the Chicago Youth Centers PERIOD

NIU Corporate Relations Director John Lewis said Jenkins position was created to increase the universities visibility and contacts. tom Montiegel NIU vice president for development and university relations said Jenkins was a good choice because of his background in sales and communication and because he is one of our own. jenkins said he took the position because it fits with my strong points and because of NIUs proximity to his home in Aurora PERIOD

He also said he is identifying key foundations and working on building the groundwork for contacts PERIOD However he said many of his contacts made previously are aware he is at NIU PERIOD

In the past four to five years the university has increased its commitment to networking in the corporate community Lewis said PERIOD

Monteigel said Jenkins is working on programs such as fundraising with the college of business dean Richard Brown and himself in the department of development and alumni relations PERIOD

Lewis said things are going extremely well since Jenkins began his work at NIU PERIOD
